title: Events
text: Events form the core of our community culture, and we organize them regularly. Who can run an event for PyCologne? In short, anyone! If you have something you want to share with the community, we encourage you to do so.

title: Events
section: Where can I find upcoming events?
text:
Where can I find upcoming events?
We use a Meetup Group to announce and share events with the public.

title: Events
text:
How can I contribute?
We have set up a GitHub organisers’ repository where issue templates guide you through the steps involved in planning and executing an event. Longer discussions take place at the monthly orga meetings on our Discord server. Do not hesitate to ask for support in the help channel on this server.

title: Events
text:
Code of Conduct
All events follow the PSF’s code of conduct.

title: Events
text:
Health & Safety Policy
Since April 8, 2023, there are no longer any government COVID-19 protection regulations in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. As our events take place in this region, we currently do not impose any COVID-related policies. However, we continue to monitor official health regulations and ask event participants to skip any events if they feel any signs of sickness.

title: PyCologne Community Website
text: This is the PyCologne Community website. Here we share knowledge, pin our documentation and distribute information for external parties.

title: PyCologne Community Website
text: This is the PyCologne Community website. Here we share knowledge, pin our documentation and distribute information for external parties.

title: PyCologne Community Website
text:
What is PyCologne?
We are a volunteer-led local Python Community Group in Cologne and invite everyone to participate to make this community thrive! We follow the code of conduct of the Python Software Foundation.

title: PyCologne Community Website
text:
Documentation
You are looking at it. This will grow over time.
For event-organisation, check out the events page.

title: PyCologne Community Website
text:
Resources
A few places where you can find us:

GitHub
Meetup
Discord
